page.title: 16OUR LOCAL VICAR
page.content: The local Vicar works very hard. He has to be an 'office manager' as there is much typing, telephoning and record-keeping to be done. He is also a Chairman, taking charge of all Church meetings. Thirdly, he is a caretaker, responsible for the care and upkeep of the Church. He is a teacher to both children and adults and in addition to this he is a pastor, visiting and helping people in need. Finally, he has to take services such as burials, marriages and christenings. His job has the advantages of a free house, holidays when he likes, a pension and a welcome into everyone's home. The hardest part of the job is trying to find time to spend with his family, as people may need help at any time. The most enjoyable part of his job is never knowing what will happen next.
